definition: -ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
to shake/to vibrate/to jolt/to quake/excited/shocked/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing thunder/☳
band/belt/girdle/ribbon/tire/area/zone/region/CL:條|条[tiao2]/to wear/to carry/to take along/to bear (i.e. to have)/to lead/to bring/to look after/to raise

pinyin: Huan2 Tai4 ping2 yang2 Di4 zhen4 dai4

sentences.english: The third prominent belt follows the submerged mid-Atlantic Ridge.
sentences.chinese: 第三個主要的地震帶沿大西洋中脊分佈。

sentences.english: Main also says that the system is likely to be applicable only to some quake zones.
sentences.chinese: 麥恩還說，預警系統似乎只能應用於某些地震帶。

sentences.english: Earthquakes are common in Japan, one of the world's mostseismically active areas.
sentences.chinese: 地震在日本很普遍，它是世界上最活躍的地震帶。

sentences.english: The problem is not a lack of technical expertise in building in earthquake zones.
sentences.chinese: 問題並不在於缺乏在地震帶建築施工的專業技術。

sentences.english: The Pacific Ring of Fire is the most geologically active region of Earth.
sentences.chinese: 環太平洋地地震帶是地球上地質活動最頻繁的地區。

sentences.english: The Americas face the Pacific Ring of Fire to their west.
sentences.chinese: 美洲大陸東臨環太平洋地震帶。
